interpreter

Class DrawingArea

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • interpreter.DrawingArea
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class DrawingArea
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Executes (and remembers) all the various drawing commands that have been issued.
    Version:
    March 30, 2009
    Author:
    David Matuszek
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addCommand

        public void addCommand(TurtleCommand turtleCommand)
        Adds a command to the list of commands to be executed in order to draw or redtaw this Canvas.
        Parameters:
        turtleCommand - The command to be remembered.

      • setTurtleData

        public void setTurtleData(int x1,
                 int y1,
                 int x2,
                 int y2,
                 int x3,
                 int y3)
        Defines the points of a triangle representing the current location and direction of the turtle.
        Parameters:
        x1 - The x-coordinate of the first point of the triangle.
        y1 - The y-coordinate of the first point of the triangle.
        x2 - The x-coordinate of the second point of the triangle.
        y2 - The y-coordinate of the second point of the triangle.
        x3 - The x-coordinate of the third point of the triangle.
        y3 - The y-coordinate of the third point of the triangle.

      • showTurtle

        private void showTurtle(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws a triangle to represent the current position of this Turtle. The triangle does not go into the DrawingCanvas's list of commands.
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics on which to draw the triangle.
